titleInfo.title: Sharḥ ashkāl al-taʾsīs شرح أشكال التأسيس Qāḍīʹzādah, Mūsá ibn Muḥammad قاضي زاده، موسى بن محمد and Sharḥ al-adwār شرح الأدوار

physicalDescription.extent: Material: Eastern laid paper (ff. 2-25); western laid paper (ff. 26-96)Dimensions: 215 x 130 mm leaf [155 x 70 mm written]Foliation: British Museum foliation in pencilRuling: Misṭarah; 19 lines per page; vertical spacing 12 lines per 10 cmScript: Naskh(item 1: ff. 2v-41r); nasta‘līq(item 2: ff.41v-91v; the scribe is Shams al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Ḥusayn al-Sijinālī [? شمس الدين محمد بن حسين السجنالي (؟), see f. 92r, line 3])Ink: Black ink, with some rubricated headings and some overlinings in red (only item 1: ff. 2v-41r)Binding: British Museum bindingCondition: Minor water damage and foxing; oil (?) stain in gutter towards head affecting approximately ff.41v-91vMarginalia: Numerous in item 1 (ff. 2v-41r)

mods.abstract: (1) Qāḍīʹzādah (قاضي زاده), Sharḥ ashkāl al-taʾsīs(شرح أشكال التأسيس; ff. 2v-41r);(2) anonymous, Sharḥ al-adwār(شرح الأدوار; ff. 41v-92r).An owner's inscription by the 'son of the learned Shaykh ‘Abd Allāh, known as al-Suwaydī' (نجل العلامة الشيخ عبد الله المعروف بالسويدي), and dated 1164/1750-51 (f. 2r) may have been written by the historian ‘Abd al-Raḥmān ibn ‘Abd Allāh al-Suwaydī al-Baghdādī (عبد الرحمن بن عبد الله السويدي البغدادي, 1722-1786), author of the Ḥadīqat al-zawrāʾ fī sīrat al-wuzarāʾ(ed. Raʾūf, 2003; see also Kaḥḥālah, Ma‘jam al-mu’allifīn, vol. 5, p. 149).
